h1: How Many Calories in Grilled Chicken?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, grilled without added oil, marinade, or seasonings.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of grilled chicken breast provides ~165 kcal and ~31 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g grilled chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 165 kcal for skinless, boneless grilled chicken breast.

faqs.q: Is grilled chicken high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100 g provides about 31 g of protein, making it a lean choice.

faqs.q: How does grilling affect chicken calories?
faqs.a: Grilling without oil keeps calories low by reducing added fats compared to frying.

faqs.q: What if I add BBQ sauce to grilled chicken?
faqs.a: Adds ~20-30 kcal per tbsp; totals could reach 185-195 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked chicken?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw is similar but cooking reduces moisture, concentrating nutrients.
